entry.title: Combined summary - BIP 177: UTPFOTIB - Use Transaction Priority For Ordering Transactions In Blocks
entry.summary: Damian Williamson, a developer, has proposed BIP 177 to address transactional reliability issues in Bitcoin where valid transactions remain stuck in the mempool for extended periods. The proposal aims to resolve two key issues: current transaction bandwidth limit and ad-hoc methods of including transactions in blocks resulting in variable and confusing confirmation times. The suggested solution is a stable fee for priority service auction model instead of an auction model for limited bandwidth. It is crucial to protect the value of fees as they will eventually be the only payment received by miners. Damian Williamson plans to post the complete proposal on his blog after incorporating feedback from various sources. Links to previous threads related to this proposal are provided.In an email to Luke Dashjr, Damian apologized for self-assigning BIP number 177 and recommended linking important information in the list welcome email. However, Luke reminded him to follow the guidelines outlined in BIP 2 and not to self-assign numbers. Damian's proposal protects the value of fees by proposing a stable fee for priority service auction model instead of an auction model for limited bandwidth. He planned to post the full proposal on his blog after incorporating feedback from various sources. Links to previous threads on this proposal were also provided.
